common_symptoms: Patchy sclerosis of the phalanges of the thumb
differentiating_symptoms: Uneven increase in bone density in thumb bone
Patchy sclerosis of thumb phalanx.description: An uneven increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the thumb.

Reduced leukocyte alkaline phosphatase.description: Decreased alkaline phosphatase measured within leukocytes.

Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the vagina.description: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the vagina.

Hypoprolinemia.description: A decreased amount of proline in the blood.

Eosinophilic infiltration of the esophag.description: Infiltration of numerous eosinophils (usually greater than 15 per high power field) into the squamous epithelium of the esophagus, and layering of eosinophils on the surface layer of the esophagus.

Neoplasm of the pancreas.description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the pancreas.

Thick vermilion border.description: Increased width of the skin of vermilion border region of upper lip.

Bifid femur.description: A bifid or bifurcated appearance of the femur as seen on x-rays, possible appearing as a more or less severe bowing of the upper leg. Might be associated with hip dysplasia on the affected side.

Anonychia.description: Aplasia of the nail. Total absence of nails.

Subpulmonary stenosis.description: A cardiovascular malformation associated with narrowing of the outflow tract of the right ventricle immediately below the pulmonary valve.

Knee pain.description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the knee.

differentiating_symptoms: Symphalangism of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 4th toe

Renal neoplasm.description: The presence of a neoplasm of the kidney.

Posterior plagiocephaly.description: Asymmetry of the posterior part of the skull. Anterior plagiocephaly may have synostotic or non-synostotic causes.

Fetal procarbazine exposure.description: A history of exposure during pregnancy of the mother of a fetus or child to procarbazine.

Underdeveloped antitragus.description: Reduction in the anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix.

Limited ankle dorsiflexion.description: Reduced ability to move the foot up toward the shin.

Appendicular spasticity.description: A type of spasticity that affects one or more limbs (arms or legs).

Anal pain.description: Pain in and around the anus or rectum (perianal region).

Lower limb muscle weakness.description: Weakness of the muscles of the legs. Inability to perform rapid, alternating movements.

Antepartum hemorrhage.description: Significant maternal hemorrhage/bleed in the second half of pregnancy and prior to the birth of the baby.

Curved 2nd toe phalanx.description: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the second toe.

Narrow foot.description: A foot for which the measured width is below the 5th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately narrow for its length.

Hyperactivity.description: Hyperactivity is a condition characterized by constant and unusually high levels of activity, even in situations where it is deemed inappropriate.

Glenoid fossa hypoplasia.description: Underdevelopment of the glenoid fossa, which is the cavity in the lateral part of the scapula which articulates with the head of the humerus.
